text.0: come hither indra with bay steeds joyous with tails like peacocks plumes.
text.1: let no men cheek thy course as fowlers stay the bird pass oer them as oer desert lands.
text.2: he who slew vṛtra burst the cloud brake the strongholds and drave the floods.
text.3: indra who mounts his chariot at his bay steeds cry shatters een things that stand most firm.
text.4: like pools of water deep and full like kine thou cherishest thy might.
text.5: like the milchcows that go wellguarded to the mead like waterbrooks that reach the lake.
text.6: bring thou us wealth with power to strike our share gainst him who calls it his.
text.7: shake indra as with hooks the tree for ripened fruit for wealth to satisfy our wish.
text.8: indra selfruling lord art thou good leader of most glorious fame.
text.9: so waxen in thy strength o thou whom many praise be thou most swift to hear our call.
